text: @useyarn Hi! Is yarn compatible with projects made in Visual Studio?

@useyarn Have to pay to not have to wait 20 mins to continue a story. The more it happens to people. The more they start to lose interest. And paying just to see pictures and videos? Also annoying asf (3/3)

@useyarn Then I see how theres 21 chapters. Is it bad that I want to read other stories? Not that one? Its very annoying to have to sit there and tap through a story you don't want to read and wait 20mins to continue. And speaking of which it's also annoying to have to pay (2/3)

@useyarn So I have downloaded the app a couple times and I hate how when you first download it. You have to read a story. No chance to choose the first story you read. I'm skipping the chats and waiting for the Timer to be over so I can read different stories. Then I see (1/2)
How soon is soon? Is there a timeline for that?

@ronmartinez For sure, we're using it in a broad sense. The phrase seems to have evolved recently to include things like Twine & Raconteur.
@useyarn In my experience interactive fiction" isn't pathway, branching stories. More software simulating a world of interacting entities."
@ronmartinez Yup, that's the idea. Yarn supports a bunch of other features too!
@useyarn When you say interactive fiction"'do you mean a branching story, like a choose your own story?"
@mossdogmusic Thanks!
@useyarn Anyway, I hope this gets up and running well, and best of luck!
@useyarn Having been a producer, I'll call that December. (Take the conservative estimate. Then add 33% pad time for disasters.) ;)
@mossdogmusic Optimistically: mid-summer. Pessimistically: early-fall. Realistically: I'm terrible at estimating software ship dates.
@useyarn Nice! Any ETA on when authors will be able to sell games through your app?
. @mossdogmusic Yup. The app and all the titles we have lined up so far are totally free.
@useyarn Will Yarn be a free app?
